definition: noisy and in disarray/in an uproar
in confusion or disorder/in a confused state of mind/disorder/upheaval/riot/illicit sexual relations/to throw into disorder/to mix up/indiscriminate/random/arbitrary
roar of laughter (onom.)/hubbub/to roar (as a crowd)
roar of laughter (onom.)/hubbub/to roar (as a crowd)

sentences.english: The noised classroom becomes quiet and we are astonished to look over at Ouyang.
sentences.chinese: 亂哄哄的教室靜了下來，我們驚異地望着歐陽老師。

sentences.english: The teacher soon reduced the noisy class to order.
sentences.chinese: 教師很快就使這個亂哄哄的班恢復了秩序。

sentences.english: The news set them arguing heatedly among themselves.
sentences.chinese: 大家聽到這個消息，亂哄哄地議論起來。

sentences.english: They're in a mess, very sweaty.
sentences.chinese: 他們渾身是汗，亂哄哄的站在一起。

sentences.english: He pounded his way through the masses.
sentences.chinese: 他左衝右撞衝出亂哄哄的人羣。

sentences.english: The teacher has charge of the fifth-year class.
sentences.chinese: 老師很快使亂哄哄的班級恢復秩序。

sentences.english: The National Guards of the suburbs rushed up in haste and disorder.
sentences.chinese: 郊區的國民自衛軍匆匆忙忙亂哄哄地趕來了。
狂熱的歌迷們亂哄哄地向前擠。
